subject: Your Microsoft 365 Business Basic subscription no longer has recurring billing
body:
Turn on recurring billing to avoid service interruptions.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   

Recurring billing has been turned off for your Microsoft 365 Business Basic subscription

Because recurring billing was turned off for Microsoft 365 Business Basic, your subscription and any associated add-on services will expire on September 7, 2024.

To avoid service interruptions, turn on recurring billing for your subscription in Microsoft 365 admin center. When recurring billing is turned on, you’ll be billed for your subscription on your renewal date.

subject: Your paid subscription starts on June 1, 2024
body:
No action needed to continue using your Microsoft services.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 

Your free trial for Microsoft Entra ID P2 will convert to a paid subscription on June 1, 2024

We hope you’re enjoying your free trial subscription to Microsoft Entra ID P2. Your free trial will end on June 1, 2024 and will convert to a paid subscription. Because recurring billing is turned on, we’ll start charging for your subscription on this date.

The estimated price of this subscription is $0.00 USD for the 25 licenses you have today. Prices are subject to change depending on the agreement you signed and any updates you make to the subscription.

You have until May 31, 2024 to turn off recurring billing or cancel this subscription before you’re charged. Make these changes in the Microsoft 365 admin center.

Additional resources

  • Turn off recurring billing
  • Cancel your subscription
  • Extend your trial subscription
  • Update your payment method
  • Add licenses

Account information

Name: Nango .

Subscription name: Microsoft Entra ID P2

Licenses: 25

Start date: May 2, 2024

Renewal date: June 1, 2024

subject: Upgrade now to reactivate your Azure free account
body:
Your free credit has expired. Learn how to keep building with Azure.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        

Upgrade now to keep building in Azure

You’re receiving this email because your free credit has expired. Because of this, your Azure subscription and services have been disabled. To restore your services, upgrade to pay-as-you-go pricing. Keep using your configured services and data and get access to 12 months of popular services for free and more than 40 services that are always free.*

Upgrade now >

Beyond the free amounts, only pay for what you use each month. It’s easy to cancel, anytime.

Your subscription data will be permanently deleted on July 7, 2024. Sign in and save any important data before then. Upgrade before July 7, 2024 to resume using your services with minimal interruption.

If you need more help, submit a support ticket.

*Based on resource and region availability.

Account information

Subscription ID: 5b9b4c73-588a-451e-97e2-23fef53f6645

Subscription name: Azure subscription 1

subject: Important information regarding your Microsoft Entra External ID trial – Upgrade now
body:
Important information regarding your Microsoft Entra External ID trial – Upgrade now

Don't lose your Microsoft Entra External ID trial – Upgrade now

Important update regarding your Microsoft Entra External ID Trial Tenant

We hope you are enjoying your free trial of Microsoft Entra External ID! Your 30-day trial has either ended or will end soon. To continue using the service, upgrade your tenant by linking an Azure subscription to your tenant. Upgrading your tenant is easy with our step-by-step guide

External ID has a robust base offer with the first 50,000 monthly active user free so you can continue to explore without incurring charges. Learn more about the Microsoft Extra External ID pricing on the frequently asked questions section of the Entra ID site.

You can also explore additional External ID features including built-in user insights, security and governance, native authentication for identity-enabled mobile applications, and more. You can learn about these new developer capabilities here.

If you do not wish to continue using External ID, no action is needed. Starting 15 June 2024, we will automatically delete trial tenants after the 30-day trial period ends. You will not be able to extend or recover your trial. If your trial has already exceeded 30 days , it will be deleted on 15 June 2024.

If you have already upgraded your trial tenant, please disregard this message.

Questions: You can find help and support from the community experts in Microsoft Q&A or Stack Overflow. With an Azure support plan, you can also get technical help by creating a support request.

Account Information

Tenant ID: 0fdf79c5-f2bb-488d-bf86-4fbf9a7e14af

Please help us improve our communication by telling us what you think about this email in a survey.

This message from Microsoft is an important part of a program, service, or product that you or your company purchased or participates in. Microsoft respects your privacy. Please read our Privacy Statement .

This is a mandatory service communication. To set your contact preferences for other communications, visit the Promotional Communications Manager .

subject: Upgrade by July 7, 2024, to keep your Azure data and services
body:
Restore your services and continue building by upgrading your account.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      

Upgrade by July 7, 2024, to save your data and keep building in Azure

You’re receiving this email because your free credit has expired. The data and services associated with your Azure account will be deleted on July 7, 2024. But it’s not too late—upgrade to pay-as-you-go pricing to restore your configured services and data. Keep building with 12 months of popular services for free and more than 40 services that are always free.*

Upgrade now >

Beyond the free amounts, only pay for what you use each month. It’s easy to cancel, anytime.

Your subscription data will be permanently deleted on July 7, 2024. If you decide not to upgrade, sign in and save any important data before then. Upgrade before July 7, 2024, to resume using your services with minimal interruption.

If you need more help, submit a support ticket.

*Based on resource and region availability.

Account information

Subscription ID: 5b9b4c73-588a-451e-97e2-23fef53f6645

Subscription name: Azure subscription 1

subject: We’re sorry to see you go
body:
Please take a short survey about your experience with Azure.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                

Let us know how we can do better next time

Your free credit expired on July 7, 2024, and because of this we’ve deleted your subscription and any associated data and services. Your experience is important to us. Please share your feedback and we’ll use it to improve our services and better meet your needs next time.

Start survey >

To start using Azure again, just sign up for a pay-as-you-go subscription. Only pay for what you use each month. It’s easy to cancel, any time.

Submit a support ticket if you need more help.

Account information

Subscription ID: 5b9b4c73-588a-451e-97e2-23fef53f6645

subject: Welcome—get started with your new Azure account
body:
Get started with popular projects and documentation.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Go to the portal >

Build your first project with your new Azure account

Welcome to your new Azure account. With pay-as-you-go pricing, take advantage of your monthly free amounts of services and only pay for what you use beyond your free amounts.

Sign in to start building your first project in Azure.

Go to the Azure portal >

Start with these popular projects:

Deploy a virtual machine

Get step-by-step guidance with a quickstart for Windows or Linux.

Create a web app

Find quickstarts for the language of your choice.

Set up a database

See documentation for your choice of databases.

More ways to get started:

  • Watch a two-minute introduction to using popular Azure services.
  • Explore Azure documentation—including quickstarts, code samples, and tutorials.
  • Learn about pricing—only pay for what you use.
  • Sign up for emails to get Azure product updates, recommendations, and best practices.
Azure portalDocumentationTrainingSupport

Account information

Subscription ID: 9669a977-de77-4555-b72d-fe6f4b393fde

subject: Your credit card was declined—update your payment information
body:
Sign in to your account to review your payment method.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      

Review or update your payment method

The credit card used to pay invoice #G055180528 was declined.

Decline reason: Declined by financial institution

Please sign in to your account and verify your payment information. Check your card number, CVV number, PIN, and expiration date, and then retry your payment. If you continue to have a problem, contact your financial institution.

subject: Action required: Pay your past due invoice to avoid Microsoft Online service interruption
body:
Sign in to review and pay your unpaid invoices.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             

Your Microsoft Online bill is past due—don’t lose access

Thanks for using Microsoft Cloud. You have a past due balance. To make sure your users have uninterrupted access to the service, please pay your invoices now.

Amount past due: $15.00 USD

If you’ve already submitted your payment, please note that it can take up to five business days for payments to be credited to your account.
